meanings.definition: The act of condescending or behaving in a patronizing manner towards others.
meanings.sent1: Her constant condescensions towards her classmates made them feel small.
meanings.sent2: His condescensions towards the new employees were evident in his tone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's condescensions towards the dog were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The condescensions of the storm clouds made the town feel insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's condescensions were like a dark cloud over the classroom.

meanings.definition: An instance of showing superiority or arrogance towards someone perceived as inferior.
meanings.sent1: The condescensions of the popular kids towards the nerds were hurtful.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his condescensions towards her intelligence.
meanings.sent3: The condescensions of the boss were so over the top, they seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: His condescensions were like a heavy weight on her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The condescensions of the queen were felt by all in the court.

meanings.sent1: His condescensions were not appreciated by his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her condescensions towards the less experienced team members.
meanings.sent3: The condescensions of the robot towards humans were oddly endearing.
meanings.sent4: Her condescensions were like a barrier between her and her friends.
meanings.sent5: The condescensions of the celebrity were the talk of the town.
